titles.title: Fourth Health Insurance Protects America--Can't Repeal IT (HIPA-CRIT) Act
To repeal provisions of the recently enacted health care reform law that prohibit preexisting condition exclusions or other discrimination based on health status for adults.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.summary: 11/29/2010--Introduced. Fourth Health Insurance Protects America--Can't Repeal IT (HIPA-CRIT) Act - Repeals provisions of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act that prohibit group and individual health plans from imposing any preexisting condition exclusion with respect to enrollees who are 19 years of age or older, effective as of the date of the enactment of such Act.
